summary: Worker performance degrades significantly over time during high-concurrency workload execution, with throughput dropping from ~100 WFs/s to ~10 WFs/s. Investigation identified that the SDK was leaking isolate references, causing memory pressure and CPU overhead.
userImpact: Users running high-throughput workflows experience dramatic performance degradation over time, making the SDK unsuitable for sustained workloads.
rootCause: SDK was leaking isolate references during workflow activation, causing memory pressure and preventing proper garbage collection.
proposedFix: Fix pending - requires proper cleanup and disposal of workflow isolate context references after activation.
workaround: Use a larger pool of isolates (e.g., 8 instead of 1) to reduce degradation severity, though this doesn't eliminate the problem.
resolutionDetails: Isolate reference leak was identified and fixed through proper lifecycle management of workflow isolate contexts.
keyQuote: After further investigation, seems like the cause was the SDK leaking isolate references.
